Location: Paris, France (Hybrid – 3 days onsite, 2 days remote)
Experience: 3+ years of professional experience in a full-stack development role
Skills: Strong grasp of modern JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3, Ability to build responsive UIs and maintain stateful components, Comfort with API testing tools like Postman or Insomnia, Familiarity with Agile practices and code review workflows, Strong written and verbal communication skills (English required, French preferred)
Responsibilities: Build and maintain dynamic, scalable web applications using React.js and Node.js, Develop, integrate, and optimize RESTful and GraphQL APIs, Write clean, modular code that balances performance with readability, Contribute to architecture decisions and mentor junior developers, Troubleshoot bugs, optimize performance, and help ensure app stability, Participate in sprint planning, standups, and retrospectives as part of our Agile workflow
Education: A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field is required. A Master’s degree is a plus but not mandatory.

Additional Requirements: You must have the right to work in France – we’re unable to sponsor visas at this time., This is a full-time role, based in Paris (but with flexible work-from-home options)., Occasional travel to other EU offices (once or twice a year) may be expected.
